do you have the server or client installed?
or you could samba share the linux folder
simple then, samba share the files and map a network drive
then enable offline files, when you log off, you will take a copy
next time you log in you wll see whats new and update as needed so the server is always uptodate
no, youll have a cached set of files on your windows system, when you log off it'll be made local but the system will think its remote
when you log in the chanegs (as someone said about last touched) will update onto the server
this can take a while if you have lots of data so keep it as slim as possible

if windows is pulling the files over id ask in ##windows\
as the linux system is accessible and ok, you just need some windows software to pull the data over
